bibl.title: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, December 6, 1940

div1.p: Hench's Kissinger and Moran photographs cannot be found. Hutchison has requested new autographed photographs from both men.

div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, December 6, 1940

opener.dateline:
THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
December 6, 1940

div1.p:
We have your letter concerning the autographed
pictures of Kissinger and Moran and I have written im-
mediately to each of them asking them to get portraits
from their photographers, autograph them again for you
and send them to us for forwarding. A thorough search
has been made here and we do not find the pictures.
Mr. Brewer insists that they never arrived and I myself
never saw them. Miss Hough had the impression that
she had seen them, but I think that that was confusion
with some of the other pictures which did reach us.
In any case we cannot recall receiving them or find them
and so we have cut the knot by asking for duplicates
right away. Of course I have explained to these men
what happened and have insisted that they shall allow
the College to cover any expenses to which they go in
providing duplicates.

Brewer was married last week and has just re-
turned from his honeymoon and I imagine he will get to
work on the rest of your photographs immediately.
Our love to you and Mary and the kids,
div1.closer:
Affectionately yours, Hutch Doctor Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
RCH/H
